text: today I'm making a six ingredient giant
crumble cookie it's going to be this big
crumbly shareable cookie you're going to
love it and it couldn't be any easier
whisk together 1 and 3/4 cups of
all-purpose flour 1 and 1/2 cups of
blanched almonds that have been ground
or almond flour it's probably a little
easier to find blanched almonds than
almond flour and you can even use
slivered almonds and grind those up

sugar the other great thing about this

you don't have to shape a lot of cookies
everything is mixed together by hand
which I love quarter teaspoon of coarse
salt one and a half teaspoons of vanilla
extract it's a little unusual to be
adding the vanilla at this stage but
what you're going to do is just whisk
everything together
and then cut some butter in have you
noticed anything different about me
today anything anything at all if you
don't know what it is I'm not telling

cut into pieces and you can either by
hand or using a pastry cutter cut the

hand so I just wanted to show you that
you could use that if this isn't like
making pie crust you want butter
completely combined so it's not actually
really cold it's cool but a cool room
temperature you want to make sure that
all the dry ingredients are coated with
the butter and that it's fully worked in
this is a shortbread there's no egg in
it there's no milk or any other kind of
liquid it's just the butter and the
sugar and then the great almonds for
flavor and texture and then take 3/4 of
your dough mixture and pour it into a
buttered ten inch springform pan it
doesn't really matter how high the sides
are because this cookie isn't very thick
so ten by three ten by two it kind of
doesn't matter
press your mixture firmly into the
bottom of the springform pan and make
sure that it's nice and even then take
the remaining dough and sort of clump it
over the top kind of like you're making
a crumb topping on a pie or a crumb cake
you're doing is you're making a
two-layer cookie that of course will
bake together one being the firm base
that will cut and the top being sort of
a clumpy crunchy crumb topping it's
really really fun have your oven at 350
degrees and bake until it begins to turn
gold in about 25 minutes then reduce the
oven temperature to 325 it you might
want to use a thin spatula to make sure
that it releases fully from the bottom
it's going to be broken up to eat but
you don't want to break it before you
bring it to the table right and then you
can slide it out onto a board or a
serving platter and then people just
reach in and pull off a piece and enjoy
